summary: The "No Congressional Funds for Sanctuary Cities Act" (H.R. 205) proposes to prohibit the use of federal funds for any congressional earmark directed to a "sanctuary jurisdiction." The bill defines a sanctuary jurisdiction as a state or local government that has policies restricting its officials from sharing an individual's immigration status or complying with federal immigration detainer requests from the Department of Homeland Security. It includes an exception for policies limited to protecting individuals who are victims or witnesses of a crime. The act would take effect in fiscal year 2026.
